summary: The implementation successfully covers all seven requirements. The backend implements a complete booking system with Motoko, including data models, CRUD operations, and filtering. The frontend uses React with TypeScript and Tailwind CSS, providing a booking form, bookings list with filters, status management, and a professional theme with green/blue color scheme. Generated images are referenced in components as specified.

hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest explicitly lists 'Payment processing integration' and 'Real-time chat' as non-goals, but does not mention authentication. The implementation includes a full Internet Identity provider setup with hooks (useInternetIdentity.ts, useActor.ts) and authentication flow, which was not requested in any requirement.
No requirement specifies support for dark mode. The implementation includes complete dark mode color definitions and theme switching capability in the CSS, which was not requested.

hallucinated_features.description: Customer name, email, and phone captured in form but not stored in backend
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-2 requires capturing customer name and contact information (email/phone), and REQ-3 requires backend to store customer information. However, the backend Booking type only stores customerId (Principal) and does not include fields for name, email, or phone. The form collects this data but it is not persisted.
